subject: Re: [junit] Test Order Execution

--- scott.marshall@... wrote:
> I'm currently developing JUnitEE for use with a J2EE
> application, and admit to being relatively new to
> J2EE and JUnit. However, I am getting problems
> running test suites as the order of execution does
> not appear to be constant. 
> Tests are written in this order : 
> testGetVehicle() 
> testAddVehicle() 
> testSaveVehicle() 
> testDeleteVehicle() 
> 
> Overall flow is to retrieve an entity, modify it,
> then delete it. 
> 
> Tests appear to be executed in this order : 
> testDeleteVehicle() 
> testGetVehicle() 
> testAddVehicle() 
> testSaveVehicle() 
> 
> By running out of order the testDeleteVehicle()
> method cant find the modified entity, and fails its
> test. 
> 
> Using JBuilder 6, is this related to most recent
> changes and compilation ? JUnitEE itself appears to
> be working fine. Any pointers of where to look ? 
> 
> Thanks 
> 
> Scott 
> 
> 
> 
> ----------
> Get a free, personalised email address at

> TXT ALRT! Stop wasting money now. Send FREE,

> from http://another.com


First thing to do...if you want them to run in the
same order every time, make them part of the same
test.  Then have that test run the others.

However...you might want to rethink how you are
testing.  I'm sure someone else can say this better,
but the fact that order matters raises a red flag in
my mind.

-Eric
